Once again, if ÃÅ½ÃÂ³ and Sreg are constant over time our demand elasticity estimates will not be affected by this bias. On the other hand, if the share of consumers buying regular grade gasoline (Sreg) increases when prices rise (as Hastings and Shapiro (2013) suggest) then some of the decrease in quantity we observe could be a result of people substituting to cheaper regular grade gasoline rather than people reducing gasoline consumption altogether.
